error analysis: [ ("When solving TSP, it is easy to make mistakes by not enforcing the MTZ subtour elimination constraints correctly.", "When solving TSP using MTZ, fix one city’s position (e.g., u[0]=0) and apply u[i] − u[j] + n·x[i,j] ≤ n−1 for the *remaining* cities i, j≠0 with i≠j to ensure no subtours are created; do *not* apply this constraint u[i] − u[j] + n·x[i,j] ≤ n−1 for the city whose position you fixed (e.g., city 0)"), ("When solving TSPs that use MTZ order variables, it is easy to make mistakes by declaring the position/order variables u[i] as continuous, allowing fractional positions that do not correspond to a valid city ordering.", "When you implement MTZ order variables, please declare the position variable of node i, denote for example by u[i], as integer with tight bounds (e.g., u[0]=0 and 1≤u[i]≤n−1 for i>0) so the solver enforces a discrete tour ordering."), ("When solving TSP formulations, it is easy to make mistakes by allowing self-loops (x[i,i]) and counting them in the degree constraints, enabling zero-length “tours” that satisfy in/out-degree but are invalid.", "When you set up the TSP arc set, please exclude self-loops by defining x[i,j] only for i≠j (or fix x[i,i]=0) and enforce degree constraints as ∑_{j: j≠i} x[i,j]=1 and ∑_{i: i≠j} x[i,j]=1 for each city."), ("If in a TSP problem not all cities/nodes need to be visited or if there is a given visit order preference/constraint between the nodes, you have to be careful.", "If in a TSP problem not all cities/nodes need to be visited or if there is a given visit order preference/constraint between the nodes, please use binary selection x_i and assignment y_{i,k} with ∑_k y{i,k}=x_i and ∑_i y{i,k}≤1, define pos_i=∑_k k·y{i,k}, enforce any stated precedences (e.g., pos_A+1≤pos_B, …), and avoid hard-coding the number of stops or irrelevant capacity limits."), ("When solving TSP or routing variants that include per-visit service/dwell times, it is easy to make mistakes by minimizing only travel time and omitting node service times from the objective, thereby understating total time/cost.", "When you handle TSP/routing with service times, please include both arc travel times and node service/dwell times in the objective and ensure the tour returns to the start if required."), ("It is easy to make mistakes by trying to solve the problem by brute force", "Do not try to solve the problem by enumerating all possible solutions or by using any kind of reasoning alone. Instead, focus on formulating the optimization model and the python code to solve it")]
